content: My name is Maryam Abbasi from Iran.
name: Maryam Abbasi

content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had a conversation with Peter Schmidt from Germany.
name: Maryam Abbasi

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was negotiating the rental price for an apartment in München.
name: Maryam Abbasi

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: No, we did not agree on a final price.
name: Maryam Abbasi

content: If yes what was the final price? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: Since we did not agree on a final price, I cannot provide an exact number. The highest offer I made was 950 Euro per month, but Peter Schmidt was still seeking a higher price, and we did not reach an agreement.
name: Maryam Abbasi

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: As I did not reach an agreement with the negotiation partner, I would rate their likeability as a 5 on a scale from 1 to 10. This is because while they were polite and clear about their intentions, their insistence on a higher price without counter-offering made the negotiation difficult.
name: Maryam Abbasi

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: No, I did not feel discriminated or offended at any point during the negotiation. The landlord, Peter Schmidt, was straightforward about his price expectations, which led to the negotiation reaching an impasse.
name: Maryam Abbasi

content: If yes, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator
